channel.title: Posts on Will Hick's Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Will Hick's Site

item.title: B&Q, GXO, and My VR Journey
item.description:
Today was genuinely exciting. B&Q and GXO brought two trainers and a hiring manager to campus alongside a full tractor unit. We could ask questions, take photos, and discuss VR training. They’re clearly interested in what I’m building.

Historic Passion for VR

I’ve always been fascinated by VR. The idea of immersive, simulated environments stuck with me long before it became mainstream. When the Final Year Project came around, I knew I wanted this to be my focus. It’s one thing to follow a trend, another to genuinely care about the technology and its potential applications.

item.title: Secretary of Tech Connect
item.description:
This academic year, I’m serving as Secretary for Tech Connect, a new society I cofounded with two others after being invited. It’s been rewarding to help build something from the ground up.

What is Tech Connect?

A student-led networking society bridging the gap between students and tech companies. Our mission: get companies to network with students and vice versa. Building connections and understanding how companies operate is invaluable for students entering the workforce.

item.title: Third Year of University
item.description:
I’ve made it to third year. The journey has been solid so far. I’ve learned a lot and despite some struggles, I feel I’m on the right track academically. My career prospects are a different story though. The tech industry is challenging right now and securing a good internship or graduate scheme has proven more difficult than expected.

Not landing any summer internships or placements last year was a setback for my confidence. I’ve been working to rebuild it and refocus on my studies, but it’s challenging when the competition is fierce and it seems like everyone else has more experience and better connections.
